summary: The script runs simulation scenarios for children under five to compare health outcomes when pulse oximetry and oxygen are available versus when they are not. It parses log files to retrieve case‑fatality ratios and death counts, then creates visualisations to illustrate the impact of these interventions under a setting with full consumable availability and mandatory health‑seeking behaviour.
business_intent: To quantify the benefit of providing pulse oximetry and oxygen for acute lower respiratory infections in young children, supporting evidence‑based decisions on resource allocation and health‑policy planning.
